alert.note: Alert for Hunt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 02 at 7:44PM CST until March 02 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CST FOR HUNT COUNTY... At 742 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Klondike to Hawk Cove, moving east at 30 mph. At 740 PM CST, a 69 MPH wind gust was observed in Greenville. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Commerce, West Tawakoni, Wolfe City, Quinlan, Caddo Mills, East Tawakoni, Celeste, Campbell, Hawk Cove, Merit, Lake Tawakoni, Greenville City Lakes, Greenville Club Lake, Lake Tawakoni State Park, Josephine, Lone Oak, Union Valley, Neylandville and Kingston. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for north central Texas. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a small interior room. For your protection stay inside a sturdy structure and keep away from windows. These storms have a history of producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
